fields.description:
right now only {{page_id}}, {{page_title}} and {{page_type}} are available as context-parameters.

Should allow for at least all of the page descriptor's attributes avaiable in web hooks, i.e.
{code}
   { id: 1245221,
     creationDate: 1368284325491,
     lastModifierName: 'admin',
     title: 'test',
     creatorName: 'admin',
     spaceKey: 'ds',
     self: 'http://macmini.local:1990/confluence/display/ds/test',
     modificationDate: 1368552499213,
     version: 16 },
  user: 'admin' }
{code}

Again, all that information could be requested by the remote plugin, but it'd be silly having to do yet another request for such obvious information.

fields.description:
The JS API should provide ways to register callbacks for submit and cancel

Testing notes:
* It has data input [(i)|https://aqg.app.dev.atlassian.io/info?id=itHasInput]
** (/) Handle situation when mandatory information was not provided
*** 10s timeout if add-on didn't return data.
** (/) Consider empty input
*** Add-on can return empty string but empty object would trigger error on save. A submitError event will be returned
** (/) Will it handle invalid input? [(i)|https://aqg.app.dev.atlassian.io/info?id=inputValidation]
*** A submitError event will be returned
** (/) Is it forgiving of user input mistakes? [(i)|https://aqg.app.dev.atlassian.io/info?id=forgivingInput]
*** Add-on should validate input before send back
** (/) What if it failed to process input? [(i)|https://aqg.app.dev.atlassian.io/info?id=failedOnInput]
*** A submitError event will be returned
** (/) What if data is incomplete? [(i)|https://aqg.app.dev.atlassian.io/info?id=incompleteOutput]
*** Guarded by Content API
** (/) What if it takes time to return/display result? [(i)|https://aqg.app.dev.atlassian.io/info?id=takesLongToOutput]
*** Callback is asynchronous
** (/) Who can access data? Can anonymous see it?
*** Content view would check the permission.
** (/) What if there's malicious output? [(i)|https://aqg.app.dev.atlassian.io/info?id=maliciousOutput]
*** Guarded by Content API
fields.summary: Register callbacks for edit component via AC JS

fields.description:
The Problem:

When writing a static macro, its common for your add on to generate html that requires another call to your addon to generate the actual content.

The most common case is when your add on would like to include an image, it needs to generate html that contains an {{img}} tag that contains a {{src}} target in your addon.

This img src url needs to contain enough information so the addon can find or generate the image. This will often be the same url parameters that were called to the add on in the first place, but will be missing jwt parameters which are needed for authentication.

One possible Fix:

Add a 'type' field to a static macro which will give some hints to the application to allow for this html to be generated.

Example: (type=image)

Macro url  as defined in the descriptor will point directly to the resource in your add on server that generates an image (eg: /myimage.png).  Connect will generate the html containing the img tag and set the src to the defined url.  Your add on is now executing this resource with the ability to call back to Confluence and can generate the image with only one call.

Another possible Fix:

Allow the use of data urls, so that an addon can generate and embed an image in the resulting html.  This remove the second call but requires changes to the storage format policy.
fields.summary: Static Macro Common Types

fields.description:
We have no REST api to trigger and download a page pdf export, especially since the existing page pdf export url no longer triggers a download, but instead redirects to a long running task which then displays a clickable link to download the file.

Workaround
 * use the current pdf action url as is but instead of expecting a download, extract the task id from the returned html
 * poll the long running task rest endpoint for the completion of the pdf long running task https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/REST/latest/#longtask-getTask
 * extract the download link from the completed long running task status.
fields.summary: Create a rest endpoint for exporting a page as a pdf

fields.description:
The history API returns a list of items representing the change history of content.  Each item is identified by a "number".  This number is not consistent when a historical item is deleted, so cannot be used as the historical item's identifier.

# Create a page
# Edit the page to create more than 2 historical items
# Query using the /content/ID/history api and note the number property of the most recent item
# Delete one of the historical versions
# Query using the /content/ID/history api and note that the number property of the most recent item has changed

Expected: the number property is consistent (immutable)
fields.summary: History Number not consistent

fields.description:
Hi.

Our organisation has an audit issue where we need to include an additional piece of information in spaces. This has to be an additional field in the "Create Space" dialog. We're using Confluence 5.1.5.

As I've been unable to find a way to customize the current "Create Space" dialog, I've taken the "create-space.js", "create-space.soy" files and modified accordingly. However when I attempt to load the new dialog (I've modified the confluence layout to point to my new action,  /spaces/createicspace-start.action) I always get the "Page Not Found" error.

I've followed the principles in the tutorial "https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Writing+Soy+Templates+in+Your+Plugin" and although there are no errors when I add the plug-in, it seems as though it never actually loads.

Can you please offer some guidance.

Thanks,
Scott.
fields.summary: Customizing/Overriding the Create Space Dialog in Confluence 5.1.5

fields.description:
h1. Problem Definition
When getting results via REST APIs, noticed the date time values are showing UTC time (GMT+0000), even the server timezone is set to other regions such as Sydney, US, etc.
h1. Why is this important?
* This is causing confusion and inconvenience to users. It does not make sense for us to return the user.timezone to the users considering what is expected in any use case, is for the timezone to be returned as per the customer's preference. (Irregardless of how it can be converted)

Copied from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-52620
fields.summary: REST API uses UTC timezone

fields.description:
Hi Dev-Team! 

We use the Confluence remote-API to retrieve attachment-content. We found that on about 30% of the requests, the base64 encoded content is not returned correctly. Most of the times there is an invalid "null"-character added to the attachment-content, but there are also requests where the base64 binary data is corrupt. We do not see any way to get the attachment data correctly other then sending the request again. Most of the times this works fine on the 2nd or 3rd attempt. Is this a known issue? Any ideas on how this might get fixed?

Best regards,
Tobias
fields.summary: Requesting attachment via remote-API returns invalid-character

fields.description:
Some addons are going to want to have an authentication flow of some kind inside the macro editor (eg Mindmeister). When debugging their add-on, we ran into a separate issue where a redirect causes the JS bridge to be broken when you load a new page inside a dialog. This will probably be an issue for any add-ons that try to redirect in a dialog to allow a user to login to an external service.

To solve this, we could:
* Fix the JS bridge being broken by a redirect/reload
* Tell people to always do the authentication flow in a new dialog, opened over the previous one and closed after the user has logged in.
* ????
fields.summary: Decide best auth flow for addons with macro editors

fields.description: h3. Problem App vendors can currently place a link in the global navigation ({{system.header/left}}) and now in ADG3 you can optionally specify a custom icon (say a 48x48@2x PNG or SVG if you're particularly clever). This looks fantastic if Confluence is using the default color scheme (_except in 1 case_) however if it's customized it can have undesirable results ([^default-vs-custom-color-scheme.png]). bq. "...in the global sidebar the icon seems grayed out...do you know why this is?" – Customer This makes it difficult to make a connect app feel part of the new confluence experience and has confused people. h3. Technical details Currently in ADG3 the icons Atlassian have in the global nav are SVG but are embedded in the DOM of the page and the custom color scheme is applied to them using CSS. With App Vendor icons they are included in an {{}} element which makes sense for a PNG, but even if an app vendor supplies a SVG it will still use a {{}} tag which means it won't adopt the cascading styles of the custom color scheme (browser limitation). h3. Solution ideas # Detect if the vendor icon is a SVG and/or add a property in the app descriptor to specify explicitly it's an embeddable SVG. Sanitize the SVG markup and safely embed it directly into the page so it adopts custom color scheme CSS like the other icons do. # Send more information in the image HTTP request so a dynamic SVG icon can be generated using details from the lookandfeel REST API and properly cached server side and/or client side (Note: this wouldn't resolve the issue shown in [^1-out-of-4-fail.png]) h3. Current workarounds # Design an icon with a strong background and transparent shape cut out ## (!) Looks better than the alternative ## (x) Over emphasized due to differences in the visual design # Dynamically generate a SVG icon on request: {color:#aaaaaa}(Parse the Referrer HTTP header to lookup the instance by name rather than a clientKey via a JWT token, get color scheme details via {{lookandfeel}} REST API, inject colors into a dynamic SVG response){color} ## (!) Looks great in 3 / 4 situations ## (x) Poor latency and the image can't be cached # Don't use a custom icon
fields.summary: Apply custom color schemes to global Connect App icons
Unable to use StAX from inside TransactionTemplate due to classloader issues
